H0.text: Trenches are the crustal feature that forms when two continental plates collide.

H1.text: Rift zones are crustal features that form when two continental plates collide.

H2.text: Tidal zones are the crustal feature that forms when two continental plates collide.

H3.text: Mountain ranges are crustal features that form when two continental plates collide.

A4.text: The collisional orogeny may produce extremely high mountains, as has been taking place in the Himalayas for the last 65 million years.

A5.text: Orogeny is a mountain-building process that takes place at a convergent plate margin when plate motion compresses the margin.
